snippet: South Korean analysts said a meeting of North Korea’s Parliament later this month may officially introduce Kim Jong-un’s program to revitalize his country’s moribund economy.
abstract: North Korea says that it will convene an unusual session of its Parliament this month, that South Korean analysts say might officially introduce a program by the country’s leader, Kim Jong-un, to revitalize the nation’s moribund economy; various reports say that Kim plans to give factories and collective farms incentives aimed at increasing productivity.
lead_paragraph: South Korean analysts said a meeting of North Korea’s Parliament later this month may officially introduce Kim Jong-un’s program to revitalize his country’s moribund economy.

headline.seo: North Korea May Be Preparing Economic Changes
headline.main: North Korea May Take Action to Jolt Economy, Analysts Say
headline.print_headline: North Korea May Take Action To Jolt Economy, Analysts Say
